contests.title: Gemini 3 Hackathon
contests.description: Welcome to the era of Gemini 3. Google DeepMind is thrilled to invite you to the Gemini 3 global hackathon. We are pushing the boundaries of what AI can do by enhancing reasoning capabilities, unlocking multimodal experiences and reducing latency. Now, we want to see what you can create with our most capable and intelligent model family to date. Whether you are a seasoned AI engineer or writing your first line of code, this is your invitation to build the future. We are looking for more than just another chat interface. We want to see fun, creative, next-generation applications built with the Gemini 3 family Why participate? Be First: Get hands-on access to the Gemini 3 API before the rest of the world catches up. Build Something New: This challenge is strictly for new applications. It‚Äôs a level playing field for everyone. Win Big: We have a prize pool of $100,000 + interviews with the AI Futures Fund team for an opportunity to fund your project.
contests.summary: Welcome to the era of Gemini 3. Google DeepMind is thrilled to invite you to the Gemini 3 global hackathon. We are pushing the boundaries of what AI can do by enhancing reasoning capabilities, unlocki...

contests.title: Sky‚Äôs the Limit - Cloud9 x JetBrains Hackathon
contests.description: Welcome to Sky‚Äôs the Limit - Cloud9 x JetBrains Hackathon Cloud9 is bringing its competitive spirit from the arena to the dev world‚Äîwith a global hackathon built to ignite creativity, sharpen skills, and bring bold ideas to life. As one of the most storied organizations in esports, Cloud9 is known for championship rosters, fierce innovation, and a community that pushes the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible. Whether you‚Äôre a gamer, a builder, or a curious creator, this is your chance to level up alongside a team that never stops evolving. In this hackathon, entrants will build or update a working application using the tools of their choice‚Äîplus optional support from JetBrains‚Äô AI Coding Agent, Junie. Junie can help accelerate your workflow and unlock new ways to create, but the real spotlight is on you and the ideas you bring to the table. With exclusive resources like official esports data for League of Legends and VALORANT provided by GRID, expert guidance, and a prize pool that rewards innovation, this is your arena. Pick a category, lock in, and show Cloud9 what you can build. Why join? Experiment with JetBrains IDEs + AI Coding Agent Junie Official data provided by GRID Compete for $25k cash prizes, GDC tickets + travel, and Cloud9 swag Get Started Review our Submission Specifics tab Apply here to get access to the official esports data from GRID Download and open your JetBrains IDE and start coding! Learn how to create an AI-powered app with AI Coding Agent Junie

contests.title: Hex-a-thon
contests.description: About the challenge Use Hex and publicly available datasets to build insights, dashboards, or applications that solve real-world problems or uncover new opportunities. Bring your own dataset, explore a topic you care about, or experiment with something completely new. Whether you‚Äôre solving a real-world problem, testing a wild idea, or just having fun with data, this is your chance to build something that makes an impact ‚Äî with Hex as your canvas. What is Hex? Step into the future of analytics with Hex, the only unified platform for data impact. Hex combines the best of analytics, data science, and AI ‚Äî all in one collaborative workspace. In Hex, you can: Analyze & Explore: Work end-to-end in a powerful, flexible notebook for analysts, engineers, and data scientists. Build & Share: Turn analyses into beautiful, interactive data apps for teammates or the world. Discover with AI: Use AI-powered data exploration to enable true self-serve analytics and make insights accessible to everyone. Hex is redefining what analytics tools look like in the AI era ‚Äî empowering you to go beyond dashboards and build intelligent, conversational, and connected data experiences.
contests.summary: About the challenge Use Hex and publicly available datasets to build insights, dashboards, or applications that solve real-world problems or uncover new opportunities. Bring your own dataset, explore ...

contests.title: RevenueCat Shipyard: Creator Contest
contests.description: ‚õ¥Ô∏è Welcome to Shipyard: Creator Contest ‚Äî an app-building challenge where real influencers enlist you to build, launch, and monetize an MVP app for their audience. In four weeks or less. ABOUT THE CHALLENGE Shipyard: Creator Contest is about building real, monetizable apps for influencers‚Äô and their audiences. Rather than creating demos for judges, you‚Äôre tasked with shipping a working MVP for an influencer and their community. We‚Äôve partnered with seven creators representing different niches, who‚Äôve provided seven briefs about the kind of mobile app they ‚Äî and their followers ‚Äî are looking for. Browse the briefs, learn about the problem each influencer‚Äôs app is hoping to solve, and get stuck into building something real for a pre-validated audience willing to try (and pay for!) your app. Alongside our panel of judges, the influencers will pick seven winning apps. But you don‚Äôt just get cash. You gain real-world credibility, distribution through an established creator, and the opportunity to continue developing and monetizing your app beyond the hackathon. All participants will also receive our Shipping Container üì¶ a digital bundle packed with exclusive perks and offers from our partners. Ready to cast off? Haul the anchor up and let‚Äôs go! ‚öìÔ∏è HOW TO GET INVOLVED On January 15 the influencer briefs will drop: read summaries here on Devpost or watch the full brief on the official Shipyard website. Choose one influencer to build an app for, and get ideating! Design and build a working MVP mobile app for iOS or Android that fits your chosen brief Integrate RevenueCat and monetize your app ‚Äî this can be in-app purchases or subscription offerings Submit your app on Devpost by February 12: include a demo video, written proposal, and access to the build (head to the Submission Requirements section for more detail) On February 26, we‚Äôll announce our seven winners. You‚Äôll be evaluated not just on technical execution, but on audience fit, product quality, and monetization potential ‚Äî just like a real app launch. THE PRIZES The 7 winning app-builders don't just get paid, they get the opportunity to build and monetize their app with the creator and unlock a primed audience. $20,000 per winning app 7 winners Feature on RevenueCat official channels Long-term credibility (and bragging rights) Opportunity to connect with the briefing influencer These creators aren't just looking for a one-and-done MVP ‚Äî they want a long-term, profitable app. If you ship the right thing, you might just discover a whole fleet of opportunities. THE TIMELINE Here's the shipping route for your challenge... Anchors aweigh January 15: Briefs are out and registration is open. Time to start building! All hands on deck January 15 ‚Äì February 12: Four weeks to build and monetize your MVP. Land ho! February 12: Submit your link and demo video by 11:59pm PST. Captain's review February 12‚Äì14: Submissions are reviewed by judging panel and the creators. Dividing the loot February 26: Winners are announced! THE BRIEFS Each creator has provided you with a video brief, a problem statement, and some insights on their audience. You can watch all the briefs on the Shipyard website here. We‚Äôve summarized each influencer‚Äôs brief below: Sam Beckman: Cross-platform power reminders Watch the brief Sam lives by reminders, but switching between Android and iOS means rebuilding his entire system from scratch. He wants a beautiful, fully functional reminders app on both iOS + Android with custom snoozes from notifications, powerful recurring rules, and true sync so dismissing once clears everywhere. Gabby Beckford (PacksLight): Dream-to-do challenges for ambitious women Watch the brief Gabby‚Äôs community is full of smart, adventurous women who want big trips and big life upgrades, but often get stuck between inspiration and action. Build an upbeat, motivating app that turns goals into daily micro-actions, with challenges, streaks/wins, tracking, and gamified moments that make progress feel fun (yes, confetti welcome). Josh (VisualFaktory): One portfolio to track them all Watch the brief Investors juggle stocks, gold, funds, fixed income, real estate, and more across multiple platforms ‚Äî messy to track and hard to understand at a glance. Josh wants a single app where users can log everything, get real-time price updates where possible, set amortization/reminder alerts for non-listed products, and unlock premium risk + diversification analysis (like country/sector exposure). Simon (Better Creating): Minimalist AI coaching in your pocket Watch the brief Simon‚Äôs audience loves productivity, great design, and building systems ‚Äî and he wants to bring coaching to more people. Create a clean, minimal mobile app where users can browse, create, and share AI coaches, add personal context/values, and start chatting immediately. No complex setup, just guidance at the right moment. Eitan Bernath: From saved recipe to dinner made Watch the brief Eitan wants to help people actually cook what they‚Äôve been meaning to make. Think tools that turn inspiration into action: an app that can generate a grocery list from a recipe video/link, organize what you want to cook, and make it simple to go from ‚ÄúI saw this‚Äù to ‚Äúit‚Äôs on the table.‚Äù Quin Gable: A trusted community for van-lifers to connect Watch the brief Dating and making friends on the road is hard when you‚Äôre always moving‚Äîand van life is a tight, protective community. Quin wants a van-life app with nomadic dating, activity-based friend finding, and even a paid 'builder help' section for van projects, with invite-only or verified access to keep it safe and intentional. Rebecca Louise: Money confidence for busy mums Watch the brief Rebecca hears it constantly: mums are short on time, want financial independence, and need practical help. Build an app that offers everyday money-saving guidance (shopping swaps, batch cooking, cost comparisons, home reno savings) plus an approachable path into investing basics so users can grow what they have, without overwhelm. RULES We're keeping it simple: Build the app you want. The only catch? You must use RevenueCat and monetize through RevenueCat. For full rules and all the Ts&Cs, go to the Rules tab on Devpost. Follow RevenueCat on Twitter @RevenueCat for the latest updates. Use #Shipyard2026 to join the conversation. You can also join the Shipyard Discord community here to connect with other participants.

contests.title: Play Everywhere: The Build with Snap Games Lensathon
contests.description: About the challenge Build a game on the most fun messaging platform: Snapchat. You‚Äôve built games for mobile, and now bring them to hundreds of millions ready to play, post, and share. Snapchat isn‚Äôt just for selfies; it‚Äôs a hub for mobile games between friends. Check out the guide on building games for Snapchat. This Lensathon asks you to build Game Lenses that turn a friendly challenge into games worth sharing. Your submission needs to belong to one of the following categories: 2D Games (Leaderboard, Quick Play), 3D Games (Bitmoji-centric, character controller), Turn Based (Multiplayer), Longform (Daily Challenges, Persistent data, story games). Design games that will be popular with Snapchatters. There is a pool of over $30,000 in prizes! Get started Build games for Snapchat with the powerful, free tool, Lens Studio, which is easy to pick up for anyone familiar with other game engines. The tool is based in Javascript and Typescript. But there are lots of ways to build without coding too. Download Lens Studio here Find tutorials and documentation for Lens Studio here Watch a tutorial series about building games on Snapchat here Learn more about the advantages of developing games for Snapchat here Get inspired by seeing the winners of a previous Snapchat Games Lensathon here
